q: One loses many laughs by not laughing at oneself.
h:
“One loses many laughs by not laughing at oneself.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Happiness must be grown in one's own garden.
h:
“Happiness must be grown in one's own garden.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.
h:
“Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.” —
Confucius

q: When you judge others, you do not define them, you define yourself.
h:
“When you judge others, you do not define them, you define yourself.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Do not ignore your gift. Your gift is the thing you do the absolute best with the least amount of effort.
h:
“Do not ignore your gift. Your gift is the thing you do the absolute best with the least amount of effort.” —
Steve Harvey

q: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
h:
“The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Stress happens when the mind resists what is.
h:
“Stress happens when the mind resists what is.” —
Dan Millman

q: The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.
h:
“The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Conquer the devils with a little thing called love.
h:
“Conquer the devils with a little thing called love.” —
Bob Marley

q: Love is not about possession. Love is about appreciation.
h:
“Love is not about possession. Love is about appreciation.” —
Osho

q: Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.
h:
“Troubles are often the tools by which God fashions us for better things.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Always show more kindness than seems necessary because the person receiving it needs it more than you will ever know.
h:
“Always show more kindness than seems necessary because the person receiving it needs it more than you will ever know.” —
Colin Powell

q: What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.
h:
“What most people need to learn in life is how to love people and use things instead of using people and loving things.” —
Unknown

q: Love yourself with the same intensity you would use to pull yourself up if you were hanging off a cliff.
h:
“Love yourself with the same intensity you would use to pull yourself up if you were hanging off a cliff.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: It is in the darkness that one finds the light.
h:
“It is in the darkness that one finds the light.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.
h:
“The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Lust, anger and greed are the three gates to self-destructive hell.
h:
“Lust, anger and greed are the three gates to self-destructive hell.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.
h:
“Failure is an option here. If things are not failing, you are not innovating enough.” —
Elon Musk

q: It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.
h:
“It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
h:
“When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.” —
Elon Musk

q: Don't let anyone define you. You define yourself.
h:
“Don't let anyone define you. You define yourself.” —
Billie Jean King

q: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
h:
“Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: I live by letting things happen.
h:
“I live by letting things happen.” —
Dogen

q: You don't need to be better than anyone else, you just need to be better than you used to be.
h:
“You don't need to be better than anyone else, you just need to be better than you used to be.” —
Wayne Dyer

q: There are no mistakes in life, only lessons.
h:
“There are no mistakes in life, only lessons.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway.
h:
“Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: The wiser you get, the less you care to look like a fool.
h:
“The wiser you get, the less you care to look like a fool.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: There is little success where there is little laughter.
h:
“There is little success where there is little laughter.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Simplicity is a difficult thing to achieve.
h:
“Simplicity is a difficult thing to achieve. ” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: Heart is what separates the good from the great.
h:
“Heart is what separates the good from the great.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.
h:
“Enthusiasm makes up for a host of deficiencies.” —
Barack Obama

q: To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
h:
“To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow. ” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: If you're brave enough to say goodbye, life will reward you with a new hello.
h:
“If you're brave enough to say goodbye, life will reward you with a new hello.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: The ego wants comfort and certainty. The soul wants to live fully.
h:
“The ego wants comfort and certainty. The soul wants to live fully.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.
h:
“The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.
h:
“To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Men trust their ears less than their eyes.
h:
“Men trust their ears less than their eyes.” —
Herodotus

q: Change is not a four letter word...but often your reaction to it is!
h:
“Change is not a four letter word...but often your reaction to it is!” —
Jeffrey Gitomer

q: There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit.
h:
“There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.
h:
“One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.” —
Dogen

q: In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.
h:
“In the midst of movement and chaos, keep stillness inside of you.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Everything is in your own heart.
h:
“Everything is in your own heart.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Think of yourself as dead. you have lived your life. Now, take what's left, and live it properly.
h:
“Think of yourself as dead. you have lived your life. Now, take what's left, and live it properly.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
h:
“The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
h:
“Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: One small positive thought can change your whole day.
h:
“One small positive thought can change your whole day.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
h:
“You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.” —
William Faulkner

q: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
h:
“The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.” —
Alfred Adler

q: The ego wants to go fast. The soul needs to go slow.
h:
“The ego wants to go fast. The soul needs to go slow.” —
Maxime Lagace
